c646d30f-13ac-4c32-baa9-955ba5e5364c: A creature targeted by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is held immobile by glowing golden chains composed of pure light. The creature is paralyzed and held in place, but may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to end the effect.[LONGSTART] While held by the golden chains, a creature cannot use any sort of extradimensional travel, such as dimension door and similar spells and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}.[LONGEND]
fd26f13b-5150-4132-bfd1-d9382562d131: A glowing, rainbow-hued pattern of interweaving colors fascinates those within it. The rainbow pattern fascinates a maximum of 24 HD of creatures. An affected creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} is fascinated by the pattern and becomes dazed.
595de5cb-7efb-4876-98b1-4d1c16402d6e: An invisible cone of terror causes each living creature in the area to become frightened unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the Will save succeeds, the creature is shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
d5c51c81-0782-4823-bfd2-dd026c4db946: An undead creature struck by the ray gains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} × 5 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for 1 hour.
674efbb8-8cca-42ff-b7fe-7203082c0072: Any creature that strikes you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} deals normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, but also takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15).[LONGSTART] Creatures with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} weapons are not subject to this damage if they {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you.[LONGEND]
6834b93a-3b3d-4995-afee-e312b27f9b2b: Blessing of Luck and Resolve, Mass
bc09755b-3c09-4bc4-9482-2d83b28c8adf: Calling upon the divine power of your patron, you imbue yourself with {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} in combat. You gain a +1 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, Strength {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and Strength-based skill checks for every three caster levels you have (maximum +6). You also gain 1 temporary hit point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Whenever you make a full attack, you can make an additional attack at your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any appropriate modifiers.[LONGSTART] This additional attack is not cumulative with similar effects, such as haste or weapons with the {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}.[LONGEND]
24fa1354-55ec-4259-9d58-913209e0285c: Chunks of hot volcanic rock and clumps of ash pound down when this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is cast, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} and 2d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} to every creature in the area. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} only occurs once, when the spell is cast. For the remaining duration of the spell, heavy ash rains down in the area. Creatures inside this area take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and the entire area is treated as difficult terrain. At the end of the duration, the rock and ash disappear, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).
40d604bf-1855-4f28-99f5-834f6ab44243: Entreating your deity for aid, you make a temporary oath of peace, granting you superior defenses but meaning you can't {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} for the duration of the oath. For as long as you are subject to this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you gain a +5 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, as well as {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/evil. If you make a direct or indirect attack or show any hostility toward any creature, the spell immediately ends.
33a4f7ba-062e-4189-a41f-6b9604c74338: Great magical hailstones pound down upon casting this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} and 2d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} to every creature in the area. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} only occurs once, when the spell is cast. For the remaining duration of the spell, heavy snow and sleet rains down in the area. Creatures inside this area take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and the entire area is treated as difficult terrain. At the end of the duration, the snow and hail disappear, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).
004878b6-d91b-40fe-86ee-82b68ecd221e: Heavy ash impedes visibility in the area. This creature takes –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
5d8e9b81-d157-40ff-bba1-0ecec866b538: Heavy snow and sleet impede visibility in the area. This creature takes –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
d8f2e0ef-1891-4c1c-9a7a-bba2c13ee46d: Protection from energy grants all allies within a 25-foot radius temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.[LONGSTART] Once the spell absorbs 12 points of energy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level (maximum 120 points) for a subject, the spell's effects end for that subject.[LONGEND]
ec7d11e9-4770-4eea-8547-eaf37c8bc8ed:
Rocky ground, stone floors, and similar surfaces shape themselves into long, sharp points that blend into the background.
Spike stones impede progress through an area and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Any creature moving on foot into or through the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s area moves at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. In addition, each creature moving through the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} for each 5 feet of movement through the spiked area.
Any creature that takes damage from this spell must also succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} to avoid {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}injuries{/g} to its feet and legs. A failed save causes the creature's speed to be reduced to half normal for 1 minute.
f9271ae1-e0e0-43dc-ba04-225c4662c69b:
Sometimes will alone is enough to move in space.
You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You can also bring with you all friendly creatures within a 10-foot radius.
d6adacc7-509c-477c-8663-c1b37b6f9dbf: Summon Nature's Ally IV (1d4+1 Giant Frogs)
8dc5b042-62a5-4e56-93cf-dada0fc2bfd1: The character is frozen in fear and can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. A cowering character takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and loses their {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus (if any).
10ea854f-ef0a-4243-bf2e-cae406d2ed47:
The target's bones (or exoskeleton) splinter, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6) to the target, which is also exhausted for 1 minute per caster level from the pain and exertion of the transformation.
If the target succeeds at its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}, it takes half damage and is fatigued rather than exhausted.
54a3f3f4-0141-4756-9bde-376129e79b9b: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashes{/g}. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/adamantine. It ignores the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon overcomes the reduction. Once the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.
93ecbedc-7782-464a-a667-8e76cd31e320: This creature can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} until it cleans the mud from its eyes.
d3651bf9-f01a-43b9-bd5b-22176313b0cb: This creature is stuck in a molten glass and tries to escape making {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g} every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
8a096c1f-dfab-4782-8ade-963f514bb95d: This creature is surrounded by a wasp swarm.
901b0751-7cf6-48d6-a875-4a78aad7cdb3:
This rune is only activated by invisible creatures, creatures affected by an illusion effect, creatures with the shapechanger subtype, or creatures that have magically changed their shape. These creatures are under effect of Faerie Fire {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, this effect lasts for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}; the symbol does not otherwise reveal their true form. Once triggered, a symbol of revelation remains active for 10 minutes per caster level.
Faerie Fire: A pale glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles. Creatures outlined by faerie fire take a -20 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. Outlined creatures do not benefit from the {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects. The light is too dim to have any special effect on undead or dark-dwelling creatures vulnerable to light.
3a312b8e-3b30-40fb-a0e7-4c1e8f233869: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to channel holy power into the weapon in your primary hand. The weapon acts as a +5 holy weapon (+5 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} damage against evil opponents). It also emits a magic circle against evil effect (as the spell).
d5172126-1d9e-4358-b2a1-91ed250aa64d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes confusion in the targets, making them unable to determine their {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} d100 and consult the following table at the start of each subject's turn each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to see what it does in that round.
01–25: Acts normally
26–50: Does nothing but babble incoherently
51–75: Deals (1d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier) to self with item in hand
76–100: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subject's self)
6a45d7fa-fcbf-4127-bb5d-f296542a8ba0:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant diminution of all allied humanoid creatures, halving their height, length, and width and dividing their weight by 8. This decrease changes the creatures' {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next smaller one. The targets gain a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a –2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a +1 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to their reduced size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal less {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A Small humanoid creature whose size decreases to Tiny has a space of 2.5 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 0 feet (meaning that it must enter an opponent's square to attack). A Large humanoid creature whose size decreases to Medium has a space of 5 feet and a natural reach of 5 feet. This spell doesn't change the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Reduce person dispels enlarge person.[LONGEND]
dc299d89-2059-4ae9-b1bd-2bd8b5cc59b5:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant growth of all allied humanoid creatures in 15 feet, doubling their height and multiplying their weight by 8. This increase changes the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next larger one. The targets gains a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a –1 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to its increased size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A humanoid creature whose size increases to Large has a space of 10 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 10 feet. This spell does not change the targets' {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Enlarge person dispels reduce person.[LONGEND]
654a5cd8-76e6-4914-8e1b-7ec21da47323:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes spines to grow from your exposed skin, damaging creatures that strike you. Any creature striking you with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15). Creatures using melee weapons with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} are unaffected by this spell.
In addition, your natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 points of piercing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
7f136d23-ede2-4bb4-8916-d7d130701e9a:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes spines to grow from your exposed skin, damaging creatures that strike you. Any creature striking you with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15). Creatures using melee weapons with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} are unaffected by this spell. Creatures that successfully grapple you take 2d6 points of piercing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per caster level (maximum +15).
In addition, your natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 points of piercing damage.
a5c4a34e-3454-493e-800b-62c6f8e2bfd2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} enables you or a creature you {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} to move and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} normally for the duration of the spell, even under the influence of magic that usually impedes movement, such as paralysis, solid fog, slow, and web. All {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to grapple the target automatically fail.
7d7529dd-312b-4cfd-97da-257f81519e35: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as false life, except you gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d10{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +20).
b0a722d8-6939-4dd6-9e6d-9f77f28da9eb: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as fireball except you can control the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to your allies; a controlled fireball deals minimum damage to them.
59809d31-4505-4584-933a-e6984519183e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like angelic aspect, except you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/evil; immunity to acid and cold; resistance to electricity and fire 10; a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison; and protective aura as {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} for the duration of the spell.
Protective aura provides a +4 deflection bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on saving throws against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to anyone within 20 feet. Otherwise, it functions as a magic circle against evil and a lesser globe of invulnerability, both with a radius of 20 feet.
Angelic Aspect: You take on an aspect of an angelic being, including some of its physical characteristics. You gain resistance to acid and cold 10, and DR 5/evil. You also gain a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves against attacks made or effects created by evil creatures. In addition, your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons you wield are considered {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
293116bf-c183-4f68-bbcf-febeb6c6a258:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like animal aspect, except you gain one aspect that adds effects to the aspects that animal aspect grants.
Gorilla: You gain a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
Monkey: You gain a +4 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g}.
Raccoon: Your competence bonuses on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} increase to +4.
Raptor: Your enhancement bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases to +30 feet.
56506659-6aa3-46a9-9b44-e8c837765e6e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like blessing of luck and resolve, except that it affects multiple creatures.
Blessing of Luck and Resolve: A favored blessing of halfling clerics, this spell grants its target a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects. If the target fails a saving throw against fear, it {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} the save with a +4 morale bonus and takes the new result, even if it is worse. After that, the spell's effect ends. If the target has the fearless racial {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}trait{/g}, it is immune to fear instead.
f65fe964-38d4-4f34-b125-8f8a1a2422a1:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
Invisibility: The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature.[LONGSTART] For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}perceptions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.[LONGEND]
bb8448b5-11bc-415f-b9cd-3743078bfdfc:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g}, except that it also dispels temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.
Restoration cures all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. It also eliminates any fatigue or exhaustion suffered by the target.
Lesser Restoration: This spell dispels any temporary magical effects reducing one of the subject's ability scores (it does not remove permanent effects such as curses or diseases) or cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of temporary ability {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one of the subject's ability scores. It also eliminates any fatigue suffered by the character. It does not restore permanent ability drain.
7be70050-6d89-4430-b88e-62cd0b14b6e2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} raises {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+2 undead skeletal champions. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
4bfe2913-a359-4df1-94f0-4ee9b45c451e: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dire wolf, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar monitor lizards, or 1d4+1 extraplanar wolves. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
50877350-1442-4b75-b839-3954ef58c359: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dire wolf. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
59109284-3d73-45f3-9ef8-5ff0e2968fe0: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a medium air elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
75763527-8c12-4829-ac09-8ac4ae086a70: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a medium earth elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
404446d4-5737-41c2-9baa-399aade5a54c: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a medium fire elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
7be17aaf-e32a-40d5-9e0c-69ea93127a35: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a medium water elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
4d9cfd9b-e025-493b-8553-23f8986cb95a: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a natural dire boar, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} natural leopards, or 1d4+1 natural giant frogs. The summoned allies appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
4f2c6c02-8aca-447c-ae1f-5110be496d72: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side a natural dire boar. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
5ec46668-de41-4f7d-ad90-aaba406f66db: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side medium fire, water, air, or earth elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
0061251d-936b-412f-9c65-4df5b2e35911: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} natural leopards. The summoned allies appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
f3c07d17-73ec-4bc7-a768-8f5600c79c91: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 natural giant frogs. The summoned allies appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
96e9531d-e50e-460a-86ff-a667a035eabd: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar monitor lizards. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
965d66a5-8f97-412b-8756-9893f420d0b4: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 extraplanar wolves. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
bd237f8b-9cdf-4d61-ba10-3d57a9aef252:
When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +20).
Since undead are powered by negative energy, this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.
2d9526e2-231a-4343-bc91-95fe572c8ab4: When you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} on a melee weapon in your primary hand, you imbue it with a powerful holy energy, granting your primary weapon the bane weapon quality against evil outsiders. Furthermore, whenever you score a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an outsider with the evil subtype, you not only deal normal critical {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with the weapon but also nauseate the outsider for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} — the outsider can reduce this nauseated condition to sickened for 1 round with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}.
d9272661-d5cc-49db-b68a-31b30fc32dea: When you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you can assume the form of a small air elemental, small earth elemental, small fire elemental, or small water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
5128deac-d130-471b-9da6-476116d319a3:
When you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you take on an aspect of a stag, including some of its physical characteristics. Your features become elongated and sinewy, and you grow a set of antlers you can use for defense. You gain a +2 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}, your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases by 20 feet, you can move through any undergrowth (including magically manipulated undergrowth) at your normal speed, and can even make a 5-foot step within such terrain.
Furthermore, when you are hit with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of opportunity, you can make a single attack with your antlers against the opponent that hit you as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. This attack uses your highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus (your choice) and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (if you are Medium; 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} if Small) plus your Strength modifier on a successful hit. The antlers have a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier of 19–20/×2.
632ae2f8-2c00-4697-994f-2b5802cbfa04: You are in leopard form now. You have a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and one 1d6 bite attack.
b85d78f8-60fb-4c56-99e5-f8dc9b0810ce: You are in small air elemental form now. You have a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} electricity 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to acid. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 30 feet. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the whirlwind ability.
2691391f-f3b9-4583-9955-211bb120443f: You are in small earth elemental form now. You have a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and a +1 bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}. You also have one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} slam attack, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} acid 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to electricity. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet.
a079aad7-a95e-417c-8376-9906cb282e53: You are in small fire elemental form. You have a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to cold. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 20 feet. You also have one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the burn ability.
28089d32-54b4-42c2-8e24-6dbbd99e4ff7: You are in small water elemental form now. You have a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} cold 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to fire. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the freeze ability.
a69bc105-c08b-4958-af06-83db46a458f6: You become a Medium leopard. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +2 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. You also gain two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and one 1d6 bite attack.
d402f88b-f089-4c8b-ad14-dafa2a7a581e:
You become a small air elemental. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +2 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} electricity 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to acid. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 30 feet. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the whirlwind ability.
Whirlwind: An air elemental can transform itself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 30 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, it cannot attack, but it is able to use its abilities.
a3c9ffb1-741f-47a3-ab7a-01dd6778ac42: You become a small earth elemental. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and a +1 bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} slam attack, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} acid 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to electricity. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet.
c8b3d20a-5d75-4da0-b21b-373a0fcf6d2f:
You become a small fire elemental. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +2 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} fire 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to cold. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 20 feet. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the burn ability.
Burn: A fire elemental deals 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} in addition to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt on a successful hit in melee. Those affected by the burn ability must also succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or catch fire, taking 1d4 damage each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for an additional 1d4 rounds. Creatures that hit a burning creature with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} take fire damage as though hit by the burning creature and must succeed at a Reflex save to avoid catching fire.
8ef54b61-b727-4a87-bbba-a00d2758c70f:
You become a small water elemental. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} cold 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to fire. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet. You also gain one {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and the freeze ability.
Freeze: A water elemental deals 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} in addition to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt on a successful hit in melee. Those affected by the freeze ability must also succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or start freezing, taking 1d4 damage each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for an additional 1d4 rounds. Creatures that hit a freezing creature with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} take cold damage as though hit by the freezing creature and must succeed at a Reflex save to avoid freezing.
8347ca8e-10e6-40b7-abaf-95909adbe5ff: You breathe out a blast of acid in the form of a 60-foot line. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
38f78fa9-02da-41f1-b8d9-f030a10479fd: You breathe out a blast of cold in the form of a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
94ac5afd-449a-44ce-bead-5c8cea2e790f: You breathe out a blast of electricity in the form of a 60-foot line. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
fb0501c8-0469-413a-abe6-fc6a3dc037f1: You breathe out a blast of energy. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} results in half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
523a809f-9b30-4ad4-add0-052fb2ed7686: You breathe out a stream of acid in the form of a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
48b26433-207f-4fa8-a0d4-0b79815175d6: You breathe out a stream of fire in the form of a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
6c7c6230-6cff-437f-be18-54e08ba1595f: You breathe out a stream of fire in the form of a 60-foot line. Creatures in the affected area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum of 12d6). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect and energy type depend on the type of dragon.
2c245ffb-466f-4f39-a459-453ee85934d8:
You call forth a surge of holy power, which grants you the following benefits: a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +4 sacred bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, resistance 5 to acid and fire, a +5 sacred bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made against evil creatures, a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} checks, and fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} 2. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} made against an evil creature with a weapon you wield is automatically confirmed.
Nongood {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} can cast this spell, but doing so causes them to be sickened (for spellcasters who are neither good nor evil) or staggered (for spellcasters who are evil) for the spell's duration.
2523b7c2-a10e-4923-8a46-beb04aebd9d0:
You call up unholy power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a cold, cloying miasma of greasy darkness. Only good and neutral (not evil) creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to a good creature (or 1d6 per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to a good outsider) and causes it to be sickened for 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces damage to half and negates the sickened effect. The effects cannot be negated by remove disease or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g}, but remove curse is effective.
The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither evil nor good, and they are not sickened. Such a creature can reduce the damage by half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.
27d21fd7-4ec1-4504-94bf-66010a5b20bb: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight to a range of 50 feet.
0db8a765-8bd4-430a-899d-17da9eaac222:
You channel lawful power to smite enemies. The power takes the form of a three-dimensional grid of energy. Only chaotic and neutral (not lawful) creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to chaotic creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to chaotic outsiders) and causes them to be dazed for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces the damage to half and negates the daze effect.
The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither chaotic nor lawful, and they are not dazed. They can reduce the damage in half again (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.
a684b7bd-64b8-4d1b-8f9d-222363d01e39: You channel positive energy to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +40) on each creature in the radius. Like other cure {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mass cure {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. An undead creature can apply {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to take half damage.
a259430d-6305-4223-816b-cca47b8a1d4e: You channel the power of good and law into the target, temporarily giving it powers similar to those of a paladin. The target gains immunity to diseases and immunity to fear. It adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to all its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} has no effect if cast on a paladin. Target has to be lawful good.
89c06878-7df0-4a0d-8e50-76d3489f8a98: You coat the targets in thick, sticky mud. The mud acts as a slow {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} and also makes targets dazed for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as they clean their eyes. A haste effect cast on a creature slowed by the mud allows it to act normally for the duration of the haste right after it cleans its eyes. Slow does not stack with the effects of slowing mud. This spell cannot dispel haste.
5867bf19-b2b3-48af-b2c3-2b8a2cca4aeb:
You convert a thin layer of the ground to molten glass that cools quickly. Creatures in the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum of 10d6) and become entangled until they make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} (the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equals the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} DC). Any creature within the area that makes a successful Reflex save takes half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and is not entangled.[LONGSTART]
The ground is covered with slippery expanses and sharp shards of obsidian. The area of effect is difficult terrain and creatures inside this area take a –5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Mobility {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. A successful DC 15 Mobility {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required to charge across the area. A creature that falls prone in the area takes 1d6 points of damage from sharp obsidian.[LONGEND]
2d4aa4da-9646-455c-a747-c9610fc872cb: You create a coating of slime on your hand. When you make a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the slime, it pulls free of you and sticks to the target, at which point it acts like green slime, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Freezing, burning, and remove disease destroys this slime. It cannot transfer to a creature other than the original target, and it dies if separated from the original target or if the target dies. Only a living creature can be the target of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
382d8ea7-30f7-470d-a85e-84a63667bb99: You create a coating of slime on your hand. When you make a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the slime, it pulls free of you and sticks to the target, at which point it acts like green slime, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Freezing, burning, and remove disease destroys this slime. It cannot transfer to a creature other than the original target, and it dies if separated from the original target or if the target dies. Only a living creature can be the target of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
e587586c-ae15-4375-b813-620a04aa1845: You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the subject simply by forming the fears of the subject's subconscious mind into something that its conscious mind can visualize: this most horrible beast. Only the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s subject can see the phantasmal killer. You see only a vague shape. The target first gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to recognize the image as unreal. If that save fails, the phantasm touches the subject, and the subject must succeed at a Fortitude save or die from fear. Even if the Fortitude save is successful, the subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
35dc4761-adc8-48eb-90bf-8cd54ae4cde5:
You create an extradimensional hole with a depth of 10 feet per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 100 feet). At the bottom of the pit is a pool of acid.
Any large or smaller creature standing in the area where you first conjured the pit must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to jump to safety in the nearest open space. In addition, the edges of the pit are sloped, and any creature ending its turn on a square adjacent to the pit must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the pit (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.
Creatures who fall into the pit take falling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per 10 feet), plus 2d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} spent in the pit. The walls of the pit are quite slippery: to climb them, a creature needs a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 30. When the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends, creatures within the hole rise up with the bottom of the pit until they are standing on the surface over the course of a single round.
d990e9ec-012c-441d-bd1d-fadbdcd90af7:
You draw down holy power to smite your enemies. Only evil and neutral creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}; good creatures are unaffected.
The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to each evil creature in the area (or 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to an evil outsider) and causes it to become blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} reduces damage to half and negates the blinded effect.
The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither good nor evil, and they are not blinded. Such a creature can reduce that damage by half (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.
1c224fb0-7f5e-4634-b6c4-8ad336e2ee0a: You emit an ear-splitting yell that stuns and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} creatures in its path. Any creature within the area is stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} negates the stun and reduces the damage by half.
bfd143c1-ed73-4418-a384-0ed363147d4d: You fill the targets' minds with feelings of tranquility. Those attempting to commit violence become stricken with wracking pain and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} they attempt to harm another creature.
e04e649b-62cf-41a7-a980-4f8e8dae179d: You force an evil creature that does not have the evil subtype to momentarily reflect on its past {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} and be overcome by grief and conscience. The target immediately drops prone and begins to loudly confess all of its sins and transgressions to the caster for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. The spell immediately ends if the target is {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g}.
52b952b1-2cc5-4e61-9b4b-c8243bb21aee: You gain a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
3f3707f8-8f8d-43ab-9ee8-734bc52f976c:
You gain a +2 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}, your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases by 20 feet, you can move through any undergrowth (including magically manipulated undergrowth) at your normal speed, and can even make a 5-foot step within such terrain.[LONGSTART]
Furthermore, when you are hit with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of opportunity, you can make a single attack with your antlers against the opponent that hit you as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. This attack uses your highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus (your choice) and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (if you are Medium; 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} if Small) plus your Strength modifier on a successful hit. The antlers have a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier of 19–20/×2.[LONGEND]
fb864d76-1665-4cdd-bfae-525d28afff69: You gain a +4 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g}.
627763da-da5a-4235-bec4-7914f386e0e2:
You point your finger and fire a black ray of negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes.[LONGSTART] You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit.[LONGEND] If you hit, the subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} temporary negative levels.[LONGSTART]
Negative levels stack. Assuming the subject survives, it regains lost levels after a number of hours equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15 hours). Usually, negative levels have a chance of becoming permanent, but the negative levels from enervation don't last long enough to do so.
An undead creature struck by the ray gains 1d4 x 5 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for 1 hour.[LONGEND]
6c0ea0f1-0e68-4e5e-8926-81eb959b286e: You summon a wasp swarm, which does not {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you. The dense cloud of vermin gives you partial {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. Any creature that makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against you takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of swarm {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and poison from the wasp swarm, but is not affected by the swarm's distraction ability.
db959b2d-bc37-4ba1-8b70-2819607eeb18:
You unleash chaotic power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a multicolored explosion of leaping, ricocheting energy. Only lawful and neutral (not chaotic) creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to lawful creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to lawful outsiders) and slows them for 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} (see the slow spell). A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces the damage by half and negates the slow effect.
The spell deals only half damage against creatures who are neither lawful nor chaotic, and they are not slowed. Such a creature can reduce the damage by half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.
eb64cc49-35fb-41bf-bae0-a5708bd3b288:
You use material from the Plane of Shadow to shape quasi-real illusions of one or more creatures, objects, or forces. Shadow conjuration can mimic any sorcerer or wizard conjuration (summoning) or conjuration (creation) {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of 3rd level or lower. Shadow conjurations are only one-fifth (20%) as strong as the real things, though creatures who believe the shadow conjurations to be real are affected by them at full strength. Any creature that interacts with the spell can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to recognize its true nature.
Spells that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} have normal effects unless the affected creature succeeds on a Will save. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth (20%) damage from the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If the disbelieved attack has a special effect other than damage, that effect is only 20% likely to occur. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save that the spell being simulated allows, but the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is set according to shadow conjuration's level (4th) rather than the spell's normal level. In addition, any effect created by shadow conjuration allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, even if the spell it is simulating does not. Shadow objects or substances have normal effects except against those who disbelieve them. Against disbelievers, they are 20% likely to work.
A shadow creature has one-fifth the {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of a normal creature of its kind (regardless of whether it's recognized as shadowy). It deals normal damage and has all normal abilities and weaknesses. Against a creature that recognizes it as a shadow creature, however, the shadow creature's damage is one-fifth (20%) normal, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} that do not deal lethal damage are only 20% likely to work. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} for each use and each affected character separately.) Furthermore, the shadow creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} are just one-fifth as large. A creature that succeeds on its save sees the shadow conjurations as transparent images superimposed on vague, shadowy forms. Objects automatically succeed on their Will saves against this spell.
b8c9498c-70c8-4a42-91ae-b17ad8e361f4: Your competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} increase to +4.
48fceb4b-f9e0-443c-b807-5ffaae26478d: Your enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases to +30 feet.
5a2a2c29-7852-4afd-b1d1-8a5b802e1aad:
{g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Injury{/g}; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 13)
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 4 rounds
Effect: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g}: 1 save
